buginformation.summary: Support for hashtag URLs
buginformation.description: I had googled #plexpass (not sure why I didn't just search within Twidere!) and the top result was https://mobile.twitter.com/hashtag/plexpass . I expected Twidere to open search results for this hashtag but instead it tried to open it as a List saying "This tweet, user or page does not exist". Twidere does correctly handle the URL https://mobile.twitter.com/search?q=%23plexpass however, which in a web browser is identical to the hashtag page.

buginformation.summary: Twidere tries to obtain location each time I open it / unlock lockscreen / start writing a tweet
buginformation.description: I have an unofficial Kitkat build for my FP1, which features a built-in app permission management. The issue I denied location access to Twidere the first time, it asked me for it. Now I get a notification overlay each time, location access gets denied. Some sceenshots to illustrate my point: This is after unlocking the lockscreen (note the notification overlay in the bottom of the screenshot): This is when I open Twidere: This is when I start writing a tweet (note that I don't attach my location to my tweet): My questions: Is it intended behaviour, that Twidere wants my location in all the above occasions? If yes, how can I turn this behaviour off? If not: Which information, other then the below, do you need to fix this? My system FP1 with MT6589 chip, running on Android KitKat 4.4.4 / Kernel Version 3.4.67 Cheers, :)

buginformation.summary: Opening left sidebar is difficult.
buginformation.description: Hello, I'm using a Motorola Moto G 2014, with screen protector and rubber case. I find it really annoying to open the left sidebar, as I have to do the exact motion or it will think I'm trying to move between tabs.

buginformation.summary: Copy ONLY the Tweet's URL?
buginformation.description: Twidere seems to allow you to copy the text of a tweet, but not just the URL by itself. If I go to the Share option, it will share the URL but it will copy the text of the tweet along with the URL. I want a way to copy ONLY the URL. In Twitter's official mobile app you can simply select "Copy link to tweet" and it does that just fine. Is there no way to do that in Twidere, or am I simply overlooking it? I love Twidere, but this is an option I've really been missing.

buginformation.summary: Crash during login to GNU Social instances

The bigger problem is that after this it won't be able to refresh the timeline or send new tweets until I destroy the database and kill the running process. Then it'll work again (no reauthentication needed).

buginformation.summary: Twitter will change the rules regarding character count.
buginformation.description: Thought this might be interesting to know for @mariotaku: Twitter announced to change the rules on how to count characters in the coming months. Short version: Up to 50 @-mentions are not counted, Media links at the end of the tweet are not counted. Long version: https://dev.twitter.com/overview/api/upcoming-changes-to-tweets

buginformation.summary: Incorrect text handling - Unicode Control Characters.
buginformation.description: Twidere doesn't correctly handle Unicode characters in the range U+007F to U+009F. Consider this Tweet https://twitter.com/edent/status/660619240077197312 The API returns Nothing\u0083\u0084\u0085\u0086 odd\u0087\u0088\u0089\u008a going\u008b\u008c \u008don\u008e \u008f\u0090\u0091here! This is how it is rendered on the latest version of Twidere. I'd suggest that the character either be stripped out, or encoded correctly before display.

buginformation.summary: Make character limit configurable per account
buginformation.description: Especially for GNU Social it is important to have a configurable character limit. Actually in a secret UI you can change the character limit (if it works), but this is unfavourable, because this setting is global. So if you want to use GNU Social and Twitter at the same time with Twidere, you have to decide on one character limit. Therefore I suggest to move this option out of the secret settings and into the "account settings", so you can set one limit per account. When posting to multiple accounts you obviously have to manage the limit somehow too. So you might split the tweet/queet if it is too long or only allow the smaller character limit.

buginformation.summary: RTL text in username causes glitches
buginformation.description: If a user's name contains RTL text (for example Arabic or Hebrew) Twidere displays the name incorrectly in timeline view: _example@ rather than @example_ For example: Here's how the Tweet is displayed on Twitter's mobile site: If we take a look at the user's page, you'll see that the user info box at the top is displaying the @ name correctly although the Arabic text is hidden behind the "Follow" button.

buginformation.summary: Feature request: Improve HTML parser
buginformation.description:
Twidere is reading the contents of the field "statusnet_html" if present. The content seems to be put into some HTML parser. This parser seems to have problems with many HTML elements. So it doesn't do a linebreak after an
or or before an . But it does something that a html parser shouldn't do: It parses linebreaks. Since it mostly is a problem that Twidere has especially with Friendica, I will write a workaround for Friendica.

buginformation.summary: bug: twidere crashes irrecoverably when scrolling to tweet containing unicode character U+00AD
buginformation.description: I follow someone who frequently tweets this character (intentionally). in Fenix, scrolling to the tweet containing this character will crash the app, but after reopening it it's possible to jump to the top to skip the tweet and use Fenix again. in Twidere, the app crashes and continues crashing immediately after opening. the official Twitter android app does not crash. Unicode Character 'SOFT HYPHEN' (U+00AD)

buginformation.summary: Feature request: Edit keyword filters
buginformation.description: I learned from https://twitter.com/twidereproject/status/310245269738504192 that Twidere's keyword filter can use wildcards. That being said, it would be great if Twidere would support editing keyword filters that have already been saved. This would be a great opportunity to tweak older filters.

buginformation.summary: Wrong time at GNU social posts
buginformation.description: I have made the observation that posts from GNU social have the wrong time. It is like the "clock" for GNU social posts gains an hour. As the following screenshot (the blurring is added by me) shows the newest posts have been posted "in 57 minutes" instead of 3 minutes ago. Twidere version is 0.3.0 dev 2016-01-26 and this bug also existed in the current version from F-Droid when I once tried GNU social with it some days ago.
